A passenger train is one which includes passenger-carrying vehicles which can often be very long and fast. Such trains are usually used for mass or high-speed transportation of people and may also be formed from very long electrically hauled multiple unit trains.
Trains are a type of rail transport consisting of a series of connected vehicles that generally run along a railroad track to transport cargo or passengers.

A passenger train is one which includes passenger-carrying vehicles which can often be very long and fast. It may be a self-powered multiple unit or railcar, or a combination of one or more locomotives and one or more unpowered trailers known as coaches, cars or carriages.
A passenger train or passenger rail service is a form of rail transport that carries passengers, generally on long-distance trains.
An intercity train is a long-distance passenger train that travels between cities.

The most common type of passenger train is a suburban train, which provides frequent stops at stations within a city or metropolitan area. Intercity trains provide service between cities. Intercity trains are faster and have fewer stops than suburban trains.

A high-speed rail is a type of rail transport that operates significantly faster than traditional rail traffic, using an integrated system of specialized rolling stock and dedicated tracks.
